definition: petty/small-minded
small/tiny/few/young

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: What are you being such a weenie for?So he has a Barbie. Big deal.
sentences.chinese: 你幹嘛這麼小家子氣他有個芭比，有什麼大不了？

sentences.english: You look petty and people have stopped listening long ago.
sentences.chinese: 那樣你會看上去很小家子氣，而聽衆也早就不想聽了。

sentences.english: Fortunately, when pregnant chan is very large, also do not show a petty.
sentences.chinese: 幸好時懷嬋十分大量，也沒有表現出小家子氣的所爲。

sentences.english: I know that political campaigns can sometimes seem small, even silly.
sentences.chinese: 我知道政治角力有時會顯得小家子氣甚至愚蠢。

sentences.english: The ungenerous child would not let anyone else play with her toys.
sentences.chinese: 這個孩子很小家子氣，她不讓任何人玩她的玩具。

harmony is to be prized
as to/considering/for
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
to fight and scheme against each other (idiom)/(in palace construction) elaborate and refined
posturing/pretentious/affected
bottomless pit
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to trust one another fully/to treat sb with sincerity
